problems.title: Unique Paths in Grid
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are at the top-left corner of an M x N grid.
You can only move right or down at each step.
Find the number of unique paths to reach the bottom-right corner.

This is a classic 2D DP problem.

DP State: dp[i][j] = number of ways to reach cell (i, j).
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 7

Sample Output
28

Explanation:
Grid is 3x7. From (0,0) to (2,6), there are 28 unique paths.
hintsList: You can reach cell (i,j) from above (i-1,j) or from left (i,j-1). Sum the paths.
dp[i][j] = dp[i-1][j] + dp[i][j-1]. Initialize first row and column to 1. Can optimize to 1D array.
